skillTree.localised_description: The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Hellsteeds are vicious. Vampires that dabble in the binding of beasts delight in breaking these wild creatures to their will.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: It is to the Plain of Bones that a Vampire Lord travels to claim a Zombie Dragon as their mount.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: "In time they will come to see that fear is a great motivator, and thank us for that gift."

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: "Cows… people… they're all basically the same at the end of the day."
This Lord of Undeath projects an aura of dominion that can wilt the most iron-willed mortals.
A dark pact has been made with darker Gods to guarantee victory.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Summon my servants, the bats. I have need of their talents."

effects.description:
Construction cost: -50% for Forest chain buildings
	(local region)

Construction time: -1 for Forest chain buildings
	(local region)

Upkeep: -100% for Fell Bats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some Vampires can change into a wolf, a great bat or a whirl of mist. In doing so, they gain all of the advantages of their new form.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Dire Wolves units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Dire Wolves units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Certain creatures should never leave the crypts in which they haunt and creep, and never be seen by ordinary mortals.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Fell Bat and Vargheist units
	(Lord's army)

Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Vargheists units (minimum 1)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Come, my night-shape servants, we have a great work ahead of us."
Trained to survive against the harshest of elements, yet still but mere puppets to the masters they unwittingly serve.

effects.description:
Range: +10% for Sylvanian Crossbowmen and Sylvanian Handgunners units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Sylvanian Crossbowmen and Sylvanian Handgunners units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
"See my coat of crimson armour? It is strengthened by thine blood and fear."
"Look into mine eyes, mortal; what glories do you see?"
The sword-strikes of mortal man are but clumsy, childish lunges before the preternatural speed of a Vampire.
Strike hard, strike true.
The strength of this Vampire to endure the centuries is beyond compare.
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Not on or below a platform
Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Not on or below a platform

Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Invocation of Nehek Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Invocation of Nehek Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: As the powers of Dark Magic are wielded for the purpose of Necromancy, its unwholesome energies invigorate the Undead.

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Vanhel's Danse Macabre Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities
Strong vs units with 25 or more entities

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Skeleton Warriors

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for "Raise Dead Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Kadon, a master of forms, was able to shift his shape into anything he chose. Here, his magic is used to summon a Varghulf, as if Kadon himself fights for you.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -6 for "Transformation of Kadon"

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Wind of Death"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Wind of Death Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wind of Death Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "I am mighty, none dare challenge me!"

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "Arise my host, my Unliving minions - bring me victory!"

skillTree.localised_description: "Can you hear it… the call of the night? Time for its children to arise and swarm."

skillTree.localised_description: Such evil spirits are desperate to spill mortal blood, and will speed along until they find some flesh to carve.

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord howls out into the night, and is answered by the baying of dark creatures.

skillTree.localised_description: Vampires summon forth the gruesome remains of the ancient dead to bolster the masses of lesser minions under their control.

skillTree.localised_description: "…and the legions of the dead envoked all hell upon the world."

skillTree.localised_description: The Undead Lord has followed the warrior's path to its ultimate conclusion, in a dark mockery of a Knight's vow.

skillTree.localised_description: The power of death cannot be denied.

skillTree.localised_description: The Dark Magic-user can take to the skies, defying gravity by metamorphosing into a bat.

Melee attack: +5 for Fell Bats, Terrorgheist and Vargheists units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Fell Bats, Terrorgheist and Vargheists units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.

effects.description:
The Dead Rise Again: +5% hit points for destroyed Undead units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

The Dead Rise Again: +10% hit points for destroyed Undead units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

The Dead Rise Again: +15% hit points for destroyed Undead units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A powerful, vigorous Lord of Darkness will see the Children of the Night gather unto them.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The sun is no ally of the dead - a sky scorched black, or darkest night, will invigorate the Unliving.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.
W'soran's scions are masters at the art of Necromancy, to dabble in such will be a boon.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

Attrition: -10% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

Attrition: -15% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord can hear the thoughts of mortals for leagues around, and plan accordingly.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +15
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Glory in your dark majesty, my lord."
Vampires and their liche-servants are devious creatures; manipulative with many mortal servants in their thrall.

effects.description:
Hero action cost: -15%
	(Heroes in local province)

Hero action success chance: +8%
	(Heroes in local province)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "They will tremble, my lord, oh, they will fear!"

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -2
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Once forbidden knowledge is acquired, Necromancers and Vampires will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(own army)

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A master indeed - to rival the Great Necromancer himself?

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: -10% for all spellcasters
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +25%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab or gouge, it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty
